channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @froomkin Nah, they would do it for NYPD cops too.
And the Israeli police riot at Shireen Abu Aqleh’s funeral has brought her killing into the Bob Dylan portion of my Twitter stream. Excellent work, folks.
@typolad Seems like it should be Saurian Brandy.
@rmneiss What if the ADL exchange programs have made the Israeli police more line their American counterparts — that is, an extractive, oppressive force designed to oppress certain minorities?
@KurtBusiek Deep in the bayou, illegally sharing mp3s, lurked the Swampster….
@Apikoros613 @Elishabenabuya Isn’t that cognate with gazer, which means both carrot and to cut?
@EladNehorai “I can’t articulate why” — seems like it might be time for some self analysis rather than just going with the flow….
@trekonomics Thesis: Woody Allen’s invocation of Marshall McLuhan was the most accurate prediction of any science fiction movie of that era.

@trekonomics @JohnArgh I figured it peaked when my kid wanted a small mining rig for his bar mitzvah. If kids are into it….
@trekonomics @JohnArgh Remind me not to underestimate my kid. That was in 2013. And this year’s Super Bowl ads were a clear sell signal so I might have gotten out in time.
@datadivajf I’m hoping they’re planning to bring in Sulu and perhaps some others — are there others ?— in year two or three.
@datadivajf Did someone ask for a someone flat song featuring Gregory Peck in the first verse? https://t.co/u11JUuw8Hu
I guess if they had to name a crypto coin after one of my pets, I’m glad they chose my current cat, not my childhood gerbil named Rashi. https://t.co/QwUDETj3iJ
@trekonomics The fact this happened in 2022 and not 2023 is the most hopeful thing I’ve seen all year.
@trekonomics I guess if they had to name a crypto coin after one of my pets, they chose my current cat, not my childhood gerbil named Rashi.
@rmneiss Not the same Steve Englehardt who wrote comics back in the seventies, I hope.

@rmneiss Has AIPAC donated?
@rmneiss Really, if I were a progressive in a primary, I would go after do-nothing bipartisanship. And use an AIPAC donation as evidence.

Spoiler: All of them. https://t.co/q4NZg3nptf
@matthewstoller has the receipts.

@gavinsblog @simoncozens @McCracKenway @tha_rami @Google @sundarpichai People really ought to be picketing Adobe about this. In 2022, “world mode,” which recognizes right to left typesets, is not part of the default install of InDesign.
@trekonomics Remember: According to Gene Roddenberry, the most likely motivation for a future villain is the desire to watch television. https://t.co/eslxm8LAJk

Could the Fifth Circuit spark the Second Civil War portrayed on Star Trek last week? https://t.co/QxSyykaS4c
As they say, it would be irresponsible not to speculate. Read the Slate article first, then follow this thread. https://t.co/g7D0DB4Xmz

@KWiersoAgain @mjs_DC @Slate This is how secession begins. Texas demands that its hitherto unconstitutional laws be enforced in California. California refuses. The Feds take Texas’ side. Corporations decide the prefer Blue America with its respect for the rule of law, and there you are.
@KWiersoAgain @mjs_DC @Slate Which would explain the brand new National Review / Tikvah Fund / et al open letter defending “The rule of law” without naming who it was subtweeting.

I wonder who was the person at AIPAC who decided that “Zionism is anti-progressivism” was a great message to propagate. I’m old enough to remember when such talk was considered antisemitic. Seems suboptimal, as they say. https://t.co/WgWD3S34Du
Speaking of the intellectual and moral honesty of the Tikvah Fund family. https://t.co/v6q4fjVjtj
Certainly a narrative well crafted to appeal to a German publisher. https://t.co/opqZuiLVf4
